column4: does azureus act odd for anybody else?  odd meaning the health icon isn't displayed, disk read errors, and the inability to close the error dialogs?
glad it's not just me -- guess now we need to find a solution ;)
just remembered something...azureus does require java5+, so using blackdown, or any other free jre prolly won't cut it
downloaded sun's jre (1.5), and switched the default jre from the free one (forget what it was called) to sun's
the ubuntu wiki page on restricted formats tells you how to switch jre's
anytime -- definitely helps to have more than one head tackling a problem.
did you get java 1.5 installed?  azureus is flyi'n for me now
i'm dl it now :) thanx for the unpade mate
